lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: What's going on today?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: My right knee has been really bothering me for six weeks. I can barely walk up stairs.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Did anything trigger the pain?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: I play basketball on weekends and it just started hurting gradually. No specific injury.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Where exactly on the knee do you feel it?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: Inside part of my knee and underneath the kneecap. Worse when I bend it.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Any swelling, redness, or warmth?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: It swells up after basketball. Usually goes down by next day.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Does the knee ever give way or lock up?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: Sometimes it feels like it might buckle. And I hear popping or clicking sounds.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: How would you rate the pain daily?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: Regular day maybe a 4, after basketball it's a 7 or 8.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: What have you been doing to treat it?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: Ice packs, ibuprofen, and a knee brace from the pharmacy.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Any family history of knee problems?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: I'm 38. My dad had knee replacement at 60 for bad arthritis.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: How's your weight?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: 210 at 5'10. Gained about 20 pounds in the last two years.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Let me examine the knee. We may need imaging.

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: I just want to keep playing basketball if possible.
